forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog after midnight. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 53. West southwest wind around 3 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog before 10am. Mostly cloudy. High near 61, with temperatures falling to around 58 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 3 to 9 mph.

weather_report:
As the evening settles over Downtown San Francisco, an ethereal blanket of patchy fog begins its slow embrace, softening the contours of the city. The air is cool, hovering around fifty-three degrees, under a mostly cloudy sky that holds a hint of mystery. The gentle breath of the west-southwest wind carries not just the chill but also whispers of the bay, as it meanders through the streets like a secret shared between neighbors. 

Tomorrow morning, the fog may linger until mid-morning, making way for a day that promises to remain mostly cloudy, with temperatures flirting with sixty-one in the early hours before dipping ever so slightly in the afternoon. This unpredictability in the marine layer invites one to dress in layers—a light jacket paired with a warm scarf is a wise choice for those venturing outside. As the calm settles in, one could wander over to a cozy café for a late-night cup of coffee, perhaps, or enjoy a leisurely stroll along the Embarcadero, letting the bittersweet scent of soft rain remember the day. A night spent tracing the familiar streets under the watchful glow of city lights beckons those seeking the solace of warmth amid the cool air.
